pages.text:
Upcoming Events
Motorcycle Events, NASCAR, Live Music And More
Join us at Boot Hill Saloon for some of the most exciting Daytona Beach events of the year! Whether you’re a motorsports enthusiast, a live music lover, or just looking for a fun weekend, we have something for everyone. Come take part in our motorcycle rallies, Bikeweek and Biketoberfest!. NASCAR fans won’t want to miss our high-speed races, where top drivers compete in intense, edge-of-your-seat competition. After the racing excitement, relax and enjoy live music performances that keep the energy going and create the perfect soundtrack for your day. Beyond motorcycles, NASCAR, and music, Boot Hill Saloon offers an atmosphere full of entertainment, great food, and a welcoming community vibe. Bring your friends and family to experience the perfect mix of speed, skill, and sound. Don’t miss out on these popular Daytona Beach events—join us for an unforgettable weekend filled with excitement and fun!

Boothill Saloon History
The Boot Hill Saloon, located in Daytona Beach, Florida, boasts a storied past as a biker-friendly venue and a favored destination for attendees during Bike Week. Since its inception in 1973, it has consistently served as a prominent gathering place for bikers and other enthusiasts, celebrated for its authentic biker culture and traditions.
Founded in 1973, the Boot Hill Saloon swiftly established itself as a central hub for bikers during Bike Week. Over the years, it earned the reputation of being a "hardcore biker bar," drawing a more traditional biker clientele, which stands in stark contrast to the increasingly commercialized environment of Bike Week in contemporary times.
The Boot Hill Saloon has trademarked its name and slogan, "Order a drink and have a seat. You're better off here than across the street," to safeguard the bar's identity and deter imitation. Even with the evolving atmosphere of Bike Week, the Boot Hill Saloon remains a sought-after destination for those in pursuit of a more authentic biker experience.
"Order a drink and have a seat, you're better off here than across the street!"

Over the years, it earned the reputation of being a "hardcore biker bar," drawing a more traditional biker clientele, which stands in stark contrast to the increasingly commercialized environment of Bike Week in contemporary times.
The Boot Hill Saloon has trademarked its name and slogan, "Order a drink and have a seat. You're better off here than across the street," to safeguard the bar's identity and deter imitation.
